thread.title: Juventus stars grounded in Porto after flight back to Italy cancelled due to ‘technical failure’ with plane
thread.title_full: Juventus stars grounded in Porto after flight back to Italy cancelled due to ‘technical failure’ with plane

author: smorgan
title: Juventus stars grounded in Porto after flight back to Italy cancelled due to ‘technical failure’ with plane
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JUVENTUS stars were left grounded in Porto after a “technical failure” with their plane delayed their flight back to Italy. 
Max Allegri’s side were due to fly back from Portugal after their Champions League last-16 first-leg 2-0 win last night. EPA 4 Juventus players were celebrating last night… only to find their flight home delayed 
But players including Paulo Dybala, Dani Alves and Miralem Pjanic were left twiddling their thumbs in their hotel for the best part of three hours. 
Goals from substitutes Marko Pjaca and Alves saw the Old Lady cruise to an away win against the Portuguese champions last night. 
But their preparations for their next clash in Serie A against Empoli have been hampered by the unexpected delay. 
Allegri reportedly organised a light training session for his players before the rearranged flight was due to take off later this afternoon. Reuters Dani Alves celebrates scoring for Juventus in their 2-0 win over Porto Corbis Max Allegri organised an impromptu training session for his players Claudio Marchisio/Instagram Claudio Marchisio learnt some more about Portuguese wine during the delay Antonio Conte leaves Juventus game as forward Paulo Dybala is subbed - Is it proof he's interested? Man Utd are the only English team left - all you need to know Brand new striker Eric has a shock in store for Nick over the latest blackmail scandal NEIL CUSTIS Wayne Rooney may have turned down China move but his Man United days are numbered... and the statement told you something was up Willy or won't he? Willy Caballero insists he will not rush new Manchester City deal despite being club's No1 keeper STAN-D AND DELIVER Time is sadly running out to organise a salute to Queens Park Rangers legend and Alzheimer's sufferer Stan Bowles 'We were stupid' Christian Eriksen blasts Spurs' display against Gent despite Mauricio Pochettino saying he's 'proud' Bon appetit Man City and Chelsea on red alert after £50m-rated Leonardo Bonucci falls out with Juventus boss Max Allegri SNARLING FOXES Sacked Leicester boss Claudio Ranieri is furious after being 'betrayed by players and board' Neil Ashton Leicester flops who cost Claudio Ranieri his job deserve to lose their Prem title medals LUIZ IS STILL IN KNEE-D David Luiz needs treatment for rest of season following Sergio Aguero horror tackle in November 
That will make up for the fact their scheduled arrival time back in Turin would not appear to allow time for one back on familiar terra firma. 
Claudio Marchisio made the most of the delay, though. 
He uploaded a photo to his Instagram showing him posing next to a book about Portuguese wine.
